author: Staff Reporter
text:
Seventy-four year old Anbu alias Sivalingam, a former Naxalite, was on Monday convicted 36 years after he hurled a country-made bomb at a team of policemen killing three of them.—Photo: C. Venkatachalapathy

On August 6, 1980, Anbu alias Sivalingam, a naxalite, hurled a bomb at a police team, killing three of them.

Thirty six years later, Sivalingam, now 74 years of age, has been sentenced to undergo five life imprisonments till death with 10 years rigorous imprisonment.

Delivering the verdict on Monday, S. Natarajan, judge of First Additional District and Sessions Court, Vellore convicted Sivalingam under sections 3 and 4 of the Explosive Substances Act and section 302 of Indian Penal Code read with section 34 of the Indian Penal Code (IPC).

“He will undergo the sentence concurrently. As per a Supreme Court ruling, life term means up to death,” S. R. Shanmugham, Additional Public Prosecutor said.

On August 6, 1980, a team of police personnel, led by Inspector of Jolarpet V. Palanisamy, nabbed naxalite Sivalingam, a resident of Vakkanampatti village, Jolarpet, along with four associates – Perumal, Rajappa, Selvam and Chinnathambi – near Yelagiri Hills.

The police personnel were taking the naxalites in an Ambassador car to Tirupattur when Sivalingam, who was hiding a country-made bomb in his inner wear, placed it in the front seat of the car.
title: Former naxalite gets five life terms for killing three policemen
